creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture; formerly given to the Center by Elizabeth and Willard Clark
description: two thin stalks of bamboo, stalk at R curves to R; taller stalk at center has three knots; two-line inscription at L
inscription: 読書餘事 {Dokusho yoji} (Reading and other things)
markings: red seals: 福田世耕 {Fukuda Seikō} [Fukuda Seikō #4], 静處 {seisho} [seisho #4]
signed: 庚午夏日古人 {kanoe-uma kajitsu Kojin} (Summer day in 1930, Kojin)
title: Black Bamboo
